meanings.definition: The act, process, or manner of presenting a play or performance.
meanings.sent1: During the staging of the school play, the students practiced their lines.
meanings.sent2: The theater crew worked hard on the staging for the upcoming musical.
meanings.sent3: The staging of the comedy show had everyone laughing in the aisles.
meanings.sent4: Her staging of the dramatic scene brought tears to the audience's eyes.
meanings.sent5: The elaborate staging of the ballet made it a visual masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The temporary structure on which something is mounted or displayed.
meanings.sent1: The art gallery used a simple staging to showcase the paintings.
meanings.sent2: The museum's staging collapsed under the weight of the sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The staging for the event was so flimsy, it fell apart in minutes.
meanings.sent4: The staging for the fashion show resembled a fragile house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The staging for the play was basic but effective in highlighting the props.

meanings.definition: The act of setting up or organizing something for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: The staging of the conference room for the meeting took hours.
meanings.sent2: She excelled in the staging of the charity event, ensuring everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: His staging of the surprise party was so secretive, no one suspected a thing.
meanings.sent4: The staging of the protest was peaceful yet impactful.
meanings.sent5: The meticulous staging of the science fair impressed the judges.
